meanings.definition: The practice of speculating in stocks or other securities in order to make quick profits.
meanings.sent1: During the agiotage, investors try to make fast money by speculating on stock prices.
meanings.sent2: The agiotage in the market led to many investors buying and selling securities rapidly.
meanings.sent3: At the agiotage, everyone was trying to guess which stocks would bring them the most profit.
meanings.sent4: The agiotage was like a fast-paced game where the winners made quick profits.
meanings.sent5: The agiotage was a whirlwind of buying and selling, all in the pursuit of immediate gains.

meanings.definition: The buying and selling of stocks or other securities in order to profit from fluctuations in their prices.
meanings.sent1: Investors engaged in agiotage to take advantage of price changes in the stock market.
meanings.sent2: The agiotage involved constant monitoring of stock prices to make profitable trades.
meanings.sent3: During the agiotage, traders were like detectives hunting for the best deals.
meanings.sent4: In the world of agiotage, every price change was an opportunity for profit.
meanings.sent5: The agiotage was a rollercoaster ride of buying low and selling high to make money.
